Dataset Managers

List of implemented DatasetManager

class entity_typing_framework.dataset_classes.dataset_managers.DatasetManager(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)

This module manages the dataset acquisition, the dataset tokenization and the dataloader creation. This module is able to use the following submodules:

dataset_reader

entity_typing_framework.dataset_classes.datasets.BaseDataset

dataset_tokenizer

entity_typing_framework.dataset_classes.tokenized_datasets.BaseBERTTokenizedDataset

dataset

entity_typing_framework.dataset_classes.datasets_for_dataloader.ET_Dataset

The __init__() stores the parameters using self, then calls read_datasets() and then saves the return of get_type_number() in type_number

parameters
dataset_paths

A dictionary defined in the yaml config file containing the dataset partititions names and paths, commonly in the format {name : path}.

The dataset paths are expected to be in the yaml config file under the key : data.dataset_paths

See the classes in Dataset Readers for more information about format of dataset_paths

tokenizer_params

A dictionary defined in the yaml config file used to instantiate the dataset_tokenizer submodule

The tokenizer parameters are expected to be in the yaml config file under the key : data.tokenizer_params

See the classes in Dataset Tokenizers for more information about the expected params

dataset_params

A dictionary defined in the yaml config file used to instantiate the dataset submodule

The dataset parameters are expected to be in the yaml config file under the key : data.dataset_params

See the classes in Datasets for more information about the expected params

dataloader_params

A dictionary defined in the yaml config file used to drive the instantiation of the torch.utils.data.dataloader.DataLoader

The dataloader parameters are expected to be in the yaml config file under the key : data.dataloader_params

See the official torch documentation for DataLoaders for more information about the expected params

rw_options

A dictionary defined in the yaml config file used to set the read/write options to load and save the tokenized datasets

The read/write options are expected to be in the yaml config file under the key : data.rw_options

rw_options is a dictionary composed of the following keys:

modality specifies the options for load and/or save the object:

  1. Create to create the tokenized version of the dataset,

  2. CreateAndSave to save it,

  3. Load to load it,

dirpath defines the read/write directory from which read or write,

light enables the save/load of the tokenized dataset w/o the original data and tokenizer (see make_light method in entity_typing_framework.dataset_classes.tokenized_datasets.BaseBERTTokenizedDataset)

create_type2id(types_dict)

Creates and store the translation dictionaries type2id and id2type

These dictionaries are used to translate from alphabetical version of a type to its token and vice versa

These dictionaries are the only way to translate a type between alphabetical and token in all the framework

get_tokenizer_config_name()

generates the name for the output file using self.tokenizer_params and self.rw_option

get_type_number()

Returns the number of the types in the whole dataset (all types in all partitions)

instance_tokenizer(bertlike_model_name)

instance a tokenizer with huggingface AutoTokenizer

parameters:
bertlike_model_name:

see bertlike_model_name in the documentation of the entire class

return:

an instance of huggingface AutoTokenizer

load_tokenized_datasets()

loads an object saved with save_tokenized_datasets, the object is loaded following the path obtained by rw_options.dirpath and the method get_tokenizer_config_name

load_type2id()

loads an object previously saved with self.save_type2id

prepare_data()

Override of pytorch_lightning.core.datamodule.LightningDataModule.prepare_data

If data.rw_options.modality is 'Create' tokenize each partition of the dataset with a dataset_tokenizer class, chosen following the configuration file value under the key data.tokenizer_params.name

If data.rw_options.modality is 'CreateAndSave' has the same behavior of Create but also saves each instance of dataset_tokenizer following data.rw_options.dirpath and data.rw_option.light

If data.rw_options.modality is 'Load' loads a previously saved instance of each dataset_tokenizer following data.rw_options.dirpath and data.rw_option.light

read_datasets()

Instances a dataset_reader for each partition in dataset_path, then calls create_type2id()

The class for dataset reader is chosen following the configuration file value under the key data.dataset_reader_params.name

save_tokenized_datasets()

saves a pickle object that contains the tokenized_dataset, the tokenizer_params, and the rw_options.light parameters

the object is saved folowing the path composed by rw_options.dirpath and the method get_tokenizer_config_name

save_type2id()

saves a pickle object that contains self.type2id and self.id2type, the file into save is obtained by rw_options.dirpath\type2id.pickle

setup(**kwargs)

Override of pytorch_lightning.core.datamodule.LightningDataModule.setup

Instance the dataset and the DataLoader for each partition.

The dataset class is chosen following the configuration file value under the key data.dataset_params.name

The DataLoader class is chosen following the configuration file value under the key data.dataloader_params.name

test_dataloader()

Override of pytorch_lightning.core.datamodule.LightningDataModule.test_dataloader

Returns the dataset partition used to test a model

train_dataloader()

Override of pytorch_lightning.core.datamodule.LightningDataModule.train_dataloader

Returns the dataset partition used to train a model

val_dataloader()

Override of pytorch_lightning.core.datamodule.LightningDataModule.val_dataloader

Returns the dataset partition used to validate a model during training
